author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: I wonder if this shouldn't be called `PlasmoDataPlots`. I understand `PlasmoData` has a `DataGraph`, but `DataGraphPlots` makes it seem like the package would more generally plot graphs of data.

Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Agreed - the package would probably be better called `PlasmoGraphsMakie` or something similar.  Ending with `Plots` usually implies a relation to `Plots.jl` which is probably not wanted.

As an aside, @dlcole3 have you looked into the monorepo pattern (https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/1251)?  It would probably make it easier for you to centralize development as well.  Having this in its own repo and making changes to the underlying data structure is pretty painful - we had that same issue in Makie before Pkg started supporting monorepos.

@goerz @asinghvi17  I like the idea of calling it `PlasmoDataPlots.jl` rather than `DataGraphPlots.jl`. Since it has a dependency on both `Plots.jl` and `Makie.jl` (`Plots.jl` is used for undirected graphs and `Makie.jl` is used for directed graphs), I am inclined to keep the `Plots` ending rather than `Makie` ending since I think I want it to be clear that it is a plotting package. This would also be somewhat consistent with `Plasmo.jl` which has an accompanying plotting package called `PlasmoPlots.jl` (see [here](https://github.com/plasmo-dev)).

@goerz @asinghvi17 What is the proper method for renaming a repository? Should I create a new repo and create a new PR through the registrator under the new name? Or is it sufficient to rename the exisiting repository (and its accompanying files)?

Rename the existing repository, and then re-register (which will create a new PR). See https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#what-to-do-when-asked-to-reconsiderupdate-the-package-name
